data.title: Hungry for Mexican food
data.text: fast service, great food, reasonable prices. Their is also a bar, so you can sit in the bar area or in the restaurant.

data.title: Friendly, Smiling Service
data.text: Although there was only one server, who also answered the phone, took take-out orders, and handled the cash register while 2/3rds of the restaurant filled up, you never felt neglected. The food was served lava hot so you know it wasn't being held under a warmer.That was the great part of this restaurant. The food was bland. The House Wonton Soup was loaded with yummy things, but the broth tasted watered down. We ordered the Po Po appetizer. They were out teriyaki beef, but the waitress (again awesome) asked what we would like as a substitute for the beef. The ribs from the Po Po were seasoned the best of anything we ordered but they were extremely fatty making them almost impossible to eat. The beef and pea pods entree had very crisp pea pods and they were a little too plentiful. The dish should have been called pea Pods and Beef. It had a small amount of a brown sauce and a few sesame seeds and no distinct flavor. Just an average dish. The House Fried Rice was also just okay. I wanted to soak it in soy sauce for flavor. The food was not bad, just average. The place is clean, the waitress was great, and prices are good.

data.title: Decent local place
data.text: The service is very good and the atmosphere is typical for a Chinese restaurant.  The menu is extensive.  The food was fresh and well prepared but needed more flavor; it was as if the chef assumed bland is America's preference.

data.title: Small but they know service & food
data.text:
This is my family's favorite Chinese Restaurant and our in laws, brothers and sisters when they visit. 

Their food is always tasty, hot when served, and their menu is varied. We recommend the Egg Fo Young, Walnut Shrimp, Dry Braised Chicken. 

Along with the good food the service is excellent and quick. They have a strong take-out business too.

data.title: Average Chinese Cuisine
data.text: They are located right next to Dimple Records, so whenever I go to dimple records I pick up some 'to go' since it's so convenient.  They are average at best and I would rather drive down Elk Grove Blvd to Hunan Garden who are cheaper and the food is much better!  however for the convenience factor they are not bad...

data.title: Nice atmosphere and good food
data.text: I first went here with a group and then again a few days later with my boyfriend. The atmosphere is very clean and inviting, better than what you might expect from their location. It wasn't very crowded either time but they seemed to have a steady stream of regulars stopping in for take-out. The sesame chicken is excellent and they will serve it a la carte even though it is only on the combo menu. The second time I went I had the beef and broccoli and it was good but a little bland for my taste. I think I'll stick with the sesame chicken. The service was extremely friendly and attentive. The only improvement would be on the timing of bringing out the dishes. Even when it was just two of us, one had to wait much longer than the other for their food to come out.
